marketNews.title: Government Pilots Village Cooperatives Starting July 19, 2025
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, stated that the trial run for the Red and White Village Cooperatives (Kopdes) will begin on July 19, 2025 - delayed from the initial plan on July 12, 2025 - with an official operational schedule set for October 28, 2025. This trial will involve approximately 100 cooperatives that have met the requirements to act as a mockup. Regarding funding, Deputy Minister of Cooperatives, Ferry Juliantono, stated that members of the state-owned bank association (Himbara) are obligated to provide a credit ceiling of up to 3 billion rupiah per cooperative with an interest rate of 6% under the Red and White Village Cooperative credit scheme. This loan has a tenor of 6 years for working capital needs and 10 years for investment purposes. Nevertheless, the regulation concerning the financing of the Red and White Village Cooperatives has not yet been officially released by the government. The number of Red and White Village Cooperatives that have obtained legal entity status as of mid-2025 has reached 74,877 units or equivalent to 93% of the 80,480 formed Village Cooperative units, according to Zulkifli. Thus, the total funds potentially disbursed by Himbara reached 241 trillion rupiah. Details of the credit distribution quota by each bank will be coordinated by the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises, where Kontan reported that the disbursement of credit for the Red and White Village Cooperatives is proposed using the 2025 KUR ceiling. The following is the KUR allocation for several State-Owned Banks for 2025: Zulkifli mentioned that the loan ceiling can be used starting July 1, 2025, although funding will only be disbursed if the Village Cooperative has a mature business plan. Meanwhile, Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated that village funds will serve as collateral in case of default by the cooperative. Previously, Himbara's involvement in the Village Cooperatives drew attention from observers regarding the risk of non-performing loans, especially amid the slowdown in the MSME sector. For context, Bank Indonesia noted that the Non-Performing Loan (NPL) for the MSME sector rose from 3.76% at the end of 2024 to a level of 4.36% during 4M25. The Red and White Village Cooperative itself is a cooperative formed as part of the government's effort to strengthen the village economy, including the development of outlets covering daily necessities, village pharmacies, village clinics, lending and borrowing business units, logistics, and cold storage. Key Takeaway: We assess that the execution and management of this program are factors that investors need to monitor. Because, although guaranteed by village funds, problems arising from this program could create uncertainty for the banking sector. Meanwhile, the potential pressure on banks' Net Interest Margin will depend on how large the mandated funding is, namely whether the credit for Red and White Village Cooperatives will reduce the KUR allocation or if there will be additions outside the existing allocation.

tickerNews.title: PNBN Divestment Plan Reportedly Halted Due to Price Mismatch
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the divestment plan for Bank Pan Indonesia by the controlling shareholders, the Gunawan family, and ANZ has stalled due to a pricing mismatch. The Gunawan family and ANZ collectively hold an 86% stake in PNBN. Previously, Reuters reported that CIMB Group and DBS Group were interested in acquiring the PNBN stake, but Reuters sources stated that neither submitted an offer because they could not meet the valuation expectation of the sellers who demanded a price exceeding 2x P/BV of the company. Nevertheless, Reuters sources mentioned that the sale process for PNBN may still proceed if the price gap can be narrowed, with CIMB reportedly still interested and open to negotiations.

tickerNews.title: BREN Inaugurates and Breaks Ground for 5 Geothermal Power Plant Projects
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy announced that it has executed the inauguration and groundbreaking ceremony for 5 geothermal power plant (PLTP) projects owned by its subsidiary, Star Energy Geothermal, in Salak and Wayang Windu, West Java. These projects are part of a 365 million US dollar investment to gradually add 112 MW of PLTP capacity, with the entire completion projected by the end of 2026. This additional capacity is equivalent to 11.4% of BREN's total current power generation capacity, which stands at 981 MW.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Stake in SCMA
tickerNews.content: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased 84 million SCMA shares at an average price of approximately 149 rupiah per share during the period of June 26 - July 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 12.5 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 64.92% to 65.03%.

tickerNews.title: Minister of Home Affairs Seeks Support to Allow AMMN Export of Copper Concentrate
tickerNews.content: Minister of Home Affairs, Tito Karnavian, stated that he had asked the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources to ease the ban on copper concentrate exports for Amman Mineral Internasional, considering the impact on the local economy. Tito said that the economy of West Nusa Tenggara - the province where AMMN operates - contracted by -1.47% YoY in 1Q25, pressured by the ban on AMMN exporting its concentrate output amid smelter construction. In March 2025, AMMN's smelter produced its first copper cathode, but the company stated that they still needed time to stabilize and calibrate the smelter for optimal operation. Previously, AMMN stated in May 2025 that it had requested leniency from the government to allow the company to export copper concentrate.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Announces Private Placement Execution Price
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada announced a private placement execution price of 288 rupiah per share, which is -15.8% lower than ENRG's stock price on Monday (7/7) at the level of 342 rupiah per share. In this corporate action, ENRG will issue approximately 1.2 billion new shares, all of which will be taken up by PT Bakrie Capital Indonesia as an affiliated party. The funds obtained from this corporate action are intended for drilling activities and working capital of PT Imbang Tata Alam, ENRG's subsidiary which acts as the operator and holder of 100% participation rights in the Malacca Strait Block.

tickerNews.title: KRYA Discusses Acquisition Goals and Previous Share Divestment by Directors/Commissioners
tickerNews.content: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya stated that the plan to acquire a 70% stake in the company led by Rich Step International Ltd. aims to develop its portfolio in the trade sector, capital injection into subsidiaries, and the electric vehicle business. KRYA also mentioned that the company has started a comprehensive due diligence process related to this corporate action. Previously, the Director and Commissioner of Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya, Brigitta Notoatmodjo and Pramana Budihardjo, jointly sold approximately 8% of KRYA shares at a price of 29 rupiah per share as part of this divestment.

tickerNews.title: DOID Subsidiary Extends Coal Mining Services Contract in Australia
tickerNews.content: Buma International Group announced that its business entity, Buma Australia Pty Ltd, signed a 2-year contract extension with BHP and Mitsubishi Alliance to continue providing metallurgical coal mining services at the Goonyella Riverside mine, Central Queensland, Australia. The value of this contract extension was not announced, but DOID stated that the duration will last until September 2027.

tickerNews.title: US President Donald Trump Threatens Additional Tariffs on BRICS-Aligned Nations
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, threatened to impose additional tariffs of 10% on any country allied with "anti-American BRICS policies," without further detailing. Trump's statement came after BRICS agreed last weekend to continue discussions on a cross-border payment system for trade and investment. Trump had previously threatened to impose 100% tariffs on BRICS if they abandoned the US dollar in bilateral trade. Indonesia has been a permanent member of BRICS since January 2025.

tickerNews.title: US Trade Partners Race for Deals as Trump Readies Tariff Notices
tickerNews.content: US Trade Minister, Howard Lutnick, stated that new tariffs set by the US government for trade partner countries will take effect on August 1, 2025. Bloomberg reported that Lutnick's statement indicated the US government will still provide time for its trade partners who have not yet reached an agreement to negotiate after the deadline on July 9, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia's Top Negotiator Visits US Ahead of Tariff Deadline
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the Indonesian Wheat Flour Producers Association (Aptindo) will sign a memorandum of understanding worth 1.25 billion US dollars to purchase at least 1 million tons of wheat per year from the US in the 2026-2030 period. This memorandum of understanding is part of a 34 billion US dollar package offered by Indonesia to the US in tariff negotiations. Indonesia's lead negotiator and Coordinating Minister for the Economy, Airlangga Hartarto, is scheduled to depart for the US on Monday (7/7) to oversee the tariff negotiations.

tickerNews.title: OPEC+ Agrees to Increase Production in August 2025
tickerNews.content: OPEC+ members on Saturday (5/7) agreed to a production increase plan of 548,000 barrels per day in August 2025. This production increase is the largest monthly increase since OPEC+ began its production recovery in April 2025. For comparison, OPEC+ had approved a production increase of 411,000 barrels per day for May, June, and July 2025, and 138,000 barrels per day in April 2025. With the production increase in August 2025, OPEC+ will have restored approximately 1.9 million barrels per day of oil production since April 2025. This production increase is part of the recovery from the voluntary cuts of 2.2 million barrels per day implemented by several OPEC+ member countries.

tickerNews.title: Saudi Arabia Raises Main Oil Prices for Asia
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Saudi Arabia raised the Arab Light crude oil price for Asian buyers in August 2025 to 2.2 US dollars per barrel higher than the regional benchmark price. This marks the highest Arab Light price in the last 4 months, indicating Saudi Arabia is optimistic that the market is strong enough to absorb additional supply from OPEC+. For context, the Arab Light price for Asian buyers in August 2025 is 1 US dollar per barrel higher compared to July 2025, exceeding the expectations of traders and the refining industry which had only anticipated an increase of 65 US cents per barrel.

tickerNews.title: AISI Domestic Motorcycle Sales Data for June 2025
tickerNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales in June 2025 reached 509,326 units (-0.3% YoY, +0.8% MoM). This result brought domestic motorcycle sales during 1H25 to approximately 3.1 million units (-2.1% YoY), equivalent to 46-49% of AISI's 2025 target range of 6.4-6.7 million units (compared to 1H24: 50% realization in 2024).

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia Forex Reserves Data for June 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that foreign exchange reserves at the end of June 2025 reached 152.6 billion US dollars (compared to May 2025: 152.5 billion US dollars), driven by tax and service receipts as well as the government's global bond issuance amidst the policy of stabilizing the rupiah exchange rate. The position of foreign exchange reserves at the end of June 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.4 months of imports or 6.2 months of imports and government foreign debt payments.
